title: Hardware accelerated data processing pipeline for proteomics
abstractText: Abstracts are not currently available in GtR for all funded research. This is normally because the abstract was not required at the time of proposal submission, but may be because it included sensitive information such as personal details.
findingsText:
This proposal builds on the results of a successful project funded by the BBSRC E-Science Programme which has led to the development of the first complete implementation in FPGA hardware of a high-performance protein identification pipeline based on MALDI-TOF mass spectrometric (MS) data. Our initial work, demonstrated that the performance achieved by our energy-efficient FPGA based solution equals that delivered by large, power-hungry high-performance computer clusters. 

The follow-up-fund awa More than 50,000 research groups are engaged in biochemical and other forms of life sciences research activities worldwide, including academic institutions, government laboratories and private foundations, as well as biotechnology, pharmaceutical and chemical companies and diagnostic laboratories. LC-MS/MS and MALDI-TOF are the instrument configurations most commonly used in proteomics research. The world-wide mass spectroscopy market was about US$1.3 billion in 2005 and should grow the fastest Aerospace, Defence and Marine,Healthcare,Pharmaceuticals and Medical Biotechnology
